sub_title: Criminologist, Owner of AV Hoek, Co-founder of Restorative Justice Nederland and co-founder of Radio La Benevolencija
summary:
Anneke van Hoek is a criminologist, media producer, writer  and social entrepreneur. She worked for 17 years as manager and consultant at a private research agency in Amsterdam (www.dsp-groep.nl) and has written numerous publications on crime issues. Anneke is co-founder, manager (2003-2008), senior advisor (2009-2015) and chair of the board (2016 until now) of Radio La Benevolencija, an NGO specialised in the prevention of ethnocentric violence with offices in Rwanda, Burundi, DRC and The Netherlands (www.labenevolencija.org). She has founded Merlijn Productions, a media and broadcasting foundation for which she produced several TV-programs, formats and trailors of theatre plays and is founder of her own consultancy firm AV Hoek. Anneke has ran for three years a victim support project in one of the most violent areas of Amsterdam and is treasurer of Levende Herinneringen which specialises in audiovisual cultural heritage. In 2010 she co-founded Stichting Restorative Justice Nederland (www.restorativejustice.nl) of which she is also project manager.

Specialties: Anneke has more than 30 years of experience in the field of crime prevention, victimology and communication and is specialised in media for social change, entertainment & education, technology & crime, business & crime, violence in the workplace, civil unrest, violence between (ethnic/religious) groups, restorative justice and police studies. She combines a strong analytical mind with creativity and an instinct for innovation. Special skills: managing multidisciplinary teams, good writing skills

projects:
[{'title': 'Rwandan Peace Education Project', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'In July 2013 Radio La Benevolencija has started a new 3-year peace education programme in Rwanda as partner in a consortium that is lead by the UK based Aegis Trust with the USC Shoah Foundation and the Rwandan Institute for Research and Dialogue for Peace as co-beneficiaries. The Swedish Embassy in Rwanda (SIDA) is the donor of this 7 million dollar programme. 
The vision of the Rwandan Peace Education programme (RPEP) is to promote social cohesion, positive values - including pluralism and personal responsibility – empathy, critical thinking and action in order to build a more peaceful society.  
The combined experience of the partners in peace media, story telling, dialogue, debate, developing community leaders and working in rural communities will take peace education in Rwanda to a new level.  
The core of the programme is a mobile exhibition with an accompanying 3-week educational programme that will tour along 20 rural communities in Rwanda. 
The role of Radio La Benevolencija is to organize in each community art and theatre workshops, performances, school debates, teacher trainings and radio debates with members of the community. Members of La Benevolencija’s local grass roots organisations will participate in these activities and function as role models. In addition to the local activities Radio La Benevolencija will continue to produce weekly episodes of their popular educational radio drama Musekeweya (New Dawn) that is broadcasted nation wide.
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Anneke', 'last_name': 'Van Hoek', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Criminologist, Owner of AV Hoek, Co-founder of Restorative Justice Nederland and co-founder of Radio La Benevolencija'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'George', 'last_name': 'Weiss', 'name': None, 'headline': 'CEO at Radio La Benevolencija HTF'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Muriel Veldman', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Anna Squier', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Crowd Control & Smart Mobs', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': "In opdracht van het onderzoeksprogramma Politie & Wetenschap kijken we op een ongebruikelijke manier naar het thema crowd control. Bij crowd control wordt bijna altijd gedacht aan het van boven en van buiten af controleren en reguleren van grote mensenmassa's. In dit project kijken we naar de mogelijkheden die mensen in massale groepen zelf hebben om de groep te reguleren en een actieve bijdrage te leveren aan de veiligheid in de groep. Speciale aandacht wordt besteed aan het verschijnsel dat tegenwoordig bijna iedereen in het bezit is van een smart phone, hetgeen de mogelijkheden voor onderlinge communicatie, zelforganisatie en zelfregulering vergroot. De verkenning zal resulteren in concrete adviezen over hoe het bestaande sociale kapitaal binnen mensenmassa's positief benut kan worden en er zullen voorstellen worden gedaan voor enkele sociale experimenten. ", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Anneke', 'last_name': 'Van Hoek', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Criminologist, Owner of AV Hoek, Co-founder of Restorative Justice Nederland and co-founder of Radio La Benevolencija'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Paul', 'last_name': 'Van Soomeren', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Expert'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Evelien Vos', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Restorative Justice in Europe: safeguarding victims and empowering professionals', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': "“Restorative Justice in Europe: Safeguarding Victims & Empowering Professionals” (RJE) is a transnational two year project that will facilitate the implementation of the EC Directives on Minimum Standards of Victims and Protection Measures.
RJE is delivered in 5 participating countries through a partnership of 5 organisations: the Institute of Conflict Resolution (Bulgaria), the University of Applied Sciences for Public Administration Bremen (Germany), Restorative Justice Netherlands (the Netherlands) and the European Public Law Organisation (Greece).
RJE’s general objective is to produce scientific and practical results that will be directly used by decision makers, policy makers and practitioners in their national implementation of the proposed two EU Directives. The produced material will be evidence-based, and will reflect the needs and wishes of victims and professionals. This will be used to:
 1.develop, pilot and implement protocols and guidelines for providing RJ in the interest of the victim and the offender with the aim of improving victims' safeguards in RJ services, and the consistent implementation of minimum standards throughout Europe
 2.develop, pilot and implement training materials and programmes for professionals (e.g. prison and probation staff, police, prosecutors, victim support workers) with the aim of improving their skills and knowledge on how they treat and interact with victims
 3.develop, pilot and implement best practice guidance that will enhance multi-agency, cross-sector cooperation among RJ/ victim services and national agencies with the aim of minimising the risks of secondary and repeat victimisation when interacting with victims.
 
The Dutch part of this project will be executed by Restorative Justice Nederland (Anneke van Hoek, project leader & Gert Jan Slump, senior researcher) and will focus on restorative justice in (youth) prison settings / secure estates. ", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Anneke', 'last_name': 'Van Hoek', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Criminologist, Owner of AV Hoek, Co-founder of Restorative Justice Nederland and co-founder of Radio La Benevolencija'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gert Jan', 'last_name': 'Slump', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Independent criminologist and criminal justice & restorative justice innovator'}]}]
